page.title: 10HICKSTEAD JUMPING COURSE
page.content: There are three main events and one for schools and several smaller events for clubs.Prize money for the three televised events is given by Everest (double-glazing) Silk Cut(cigarettes) and other big companies. Trust House Fortes do the catering, restaurant, hamburger stalls and bars. The most challenging obstacles are the Irish Bank and the Devil's Dyke, so named after O.S.263111 on the South Downs. {HICKSTEAD FIXTURE CARD 1985 30/5/85-2/6/85 Everest Nations Cup 12/7/85-14/7/85 Dubai Horse Show 23/8/85-26/8/85 Silk Cut Derby 31/8/85 Nation Schools and Pony Clubs Jumping Championships. Prize money for the Everest Stakes_ Â£1500,Â£900,Â£700,Â£500,Â£300,Â£200, and 3 at Â£100. 107 entrants competed from Holland, Sweden, Ireland, Portugal, Spain, France, Germany, Australia,etc.
